name: token
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: token
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you do, or a thing that you give someone, that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect

example.eg: As a token of our gratitude for all that you have done, we would like you to accept this small gift.
example.egtrans: 为了表示我们对你们所做的一切的感谢，希望你们接受我们这份小小的礼物。

example.eg: It doesn't have to be a big present - it's just a token.
example.egtrans: 礼物不必大——只是为了表示一下。

dsense.name: token
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper with a particular amount of money printed on it that can be exchanged in a shop for goods of that value

example.egtrans: 一张价值20英镑的书券／礼券／唱片券

dsense.name: token
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a round metal or plastic disc that is used instead of money in some machines
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某些机器中用以代替纸币的）代币，专用辅币

name: token
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Token actions are done to show that you are doing something, even if the results are limited in their effect.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有标志性的；有象征意义的

example.eg: The troops in front of us either surrendered or offered only token (= not much) resistance.
example.egtrans: 我们前面的军队要么投降，要么只作了象征性的抵抗。

example.eg: They were the only country to argue for even token recognition of the Baltic states' independence.
example.egtrans: 他们是唯一为波罗的海沿岸国家争取哪怕是象征性承认的国家。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to something that is done to prevent other people complaining, although it is not sincerely meant and has no real effect

example.eg: The truth is that they appoint no more than a token number of women to managerial jobs.
example.egtrans: 事实上他们只装装样子，任命了一些女性担任管理工作。
